channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2023110958
item.description:
Report X-2023110958

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was being unloaded the package handler noticed liquid coming out from the bottom of the pail. DescribePack: Loose seal along the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was discovered the pail was placed inside a hazmat tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, and set under the vent.

item.title: Report X-2023110420
item.description:
Report X-2023110420

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TEN POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS INSIDE TWO BROWN BAGS COOLING SEAFOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED. PERISHABLE AND KEEP FROZEN IMPRINTED ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 00W570, EVA'S WILD INC, 4786 1ST AVE S, SEATTLE WA 98134.

item.title: Report X-2023110364
item.description:
Report X-2023110364

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PLASTIC DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WERE PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB AND DMP BAG. THE DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR PROCESSING. ALL PPE WAS THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

ALL PPE (GLOVES, BOOTS, APRON, GOGGLES, SILVER LINING) WERE PUT ON AND BUCKET WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUB/PPE WERE THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS PROCESSED INTO ETT.

item.title: Report E-2023110613
item.description:
Report E-2023110613

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 20, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2810 fell off the lift gate and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental (GME) to remediate the impacted site. GME personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the UN2810-impacted trailer and roadway. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 95-gallon overpack and taken to the R+L terminal for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023110626
item.description:
Report X-2023110626

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered by workers to be wet. Inspection revealed containers loaded upside down from "up arrows" on outside of package. 4 containers had failed caps and contents leaked. Trained personnel collected up package and processed accordingly. Although box was wet, there was no apparent spill anywhere to clean up. DescribePack: Package contained spilled liquid, with cardboard absorbing all. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately upon discovery contained in proper Hazmat bucket and transported to Hazmat processing area.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet Box found in the hazmat cage DescribePack: Loose cap on one plastic container and it leaked inside the shipping box The liquid ate thru the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was put inside a plastic hazmat bag and placed in a hazmat tote under the vent in the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023101519
item.description:
Report X-2023101519

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO TEN PACKAGES DUE TO BEING COLD TO THE TOUCH AND SIGNS OF FROST FORMING ON THE BOXES. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 2 KILOGRAMS OF DRY ICE COOLING CHEESE PUFFS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. THERE ARE THIS SIDE UP, PERISHABLE, AND HANDLE WITH CARE LABELS APPLIED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1ZE0B7440223051511, 1ZE0B7440223351081, 1ZE0B7440233380496, 1ZE0B7440214988876, 1ZE0B7440231055305, 1ZE0B7440204924266, 1ZE0B7440208045502, 1ZE0B7440212981288 AND 1ZE0B7440206402441. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER E0B744, BOUGIE GOUGIES, 2212 QUEEN ANNE AVE., N, SEATTLE WA 98109.

THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. OUTER BOXES HAVE STICKERS ON THEM MARKED THIS SIDE UP, PERISHABLE, AND HANDLE WITH CARE. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1ZE0B7440200754395, 1ZE0B7440217778212, 1ZE0B7440216033778 AND 1ZE0B7440203263455. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER E0B744, BOUGIE GOUGIES, 2212 QUEEN ANNE AVE. N, SEATTLE WA 98109. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 2 KILOGRAMS OF DRY ICE COOLING CHEESE PUFFS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. THERE ARE THIS SIDE UP, PERISHABLE, AND HANDLE WITH CARE LABELS APPLIED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1ZE0B7440223051511, 1ZE0B7440223351081, 1ZE0B7440233380496, 1ZE0B7440214988876, 1ZE0B7440231055305, 1ZE0B7440204924266, 1ZE0B7440208045502, 1ZE0B7440212981288 AND 1ZE0B7440206402441. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER E0B744, BOUGIE GOUGIES, 2212 QUEEN ANNE AVE., N, SEATTLE WA 98109.

Report X-2023111088

  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA wet and leaking. When inspected, it was found that the cap came loose, spilling the contents inside the package. DescribePack: Loose cap, failed seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was bagged and sealed in a HAZMAT drum.

item.title: Report E-2023110488
item.description:
Report E-2023110488

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was pumping diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank. During the delivery, the connection between the storage tank and delivery hose was compromised. This allowed approximately 70 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Graymar Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2023110487
item.description:
Report E-2023110487

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-22
  • City: COVINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver disconnected the hose from the customer's storage tank without completely draining the residual gasoline from the hose. As a result, approximately 10 gallons of gasoline was released. Graymar Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Cap came loose inside of package, causing product to spill out into package DescribePack: outer packaging soaked in product, causing outer package to become unsuitable for transport DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: package was brought to QA in red tote immediately upon driver coming back to building, mitigating spill
